arrowParens.description: Include parentheses around a sole arrow function parameter.

bracketSpacing.description: Print spaces between brackets in object literals.

insertPragma.description: Prettier can insert a special @format marker at the top of files specifying that the file has been formatted with prettier. This works well when used in tandem with the --require-pragma option. If there is already a docblock at the top of the file then this option will add a newline to it with the @format marker.

jsxBracketSameLine.description: Put the > of a multi-line JSX element at the end of the last line instead of being alone on the next line.

printWidth.description: Specify the line length that the printer will wrap on.

proseWrap.description: By default, Prettier will wrap markdown text as-is since some services use a linebreak-sensitive renderer, e.g. GitHub comment and BitBucket. In some cases you may want to rely on editor/viewer soft wrapping instead, so this option allows you to opt out with "never".

requirePragma.description: Prettier can restrict itself to only format files that contain a special comment, called a pragma, at the top of the file. This is very useful when gradually transitioning large, unformatted codebases to prettier.

semi.description: Print semicolons at the ends of statements.

singleQuote.description: Use single quotes instead of double quotes.

tabWidth.description: Specify the number of spaces per indentation-level.

useTabs.description: Indent lines with tabs instead of spaces.

overrides.description: Provide a list of patterns to override prettier configuration.

files.description: Include these files in this override.

excludeFiles.description: Exclude these files from this override.

options.description: The options to apply for this override.
